meanings.definition: A unit of pressure equal to one millionth of a bar.
meanings.sent1: The weather report mentioned a high pressure of one microbar.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use microbars to measure tiny changes in air pressure.
meanings.sent3: I tried to weigh a microbar on the scale, but it was too light!
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as light as a microbar, barely audible in the noisy room.
meanings.sent5: The tiny insect felt the weight of a microbar on its delicate wings.

meanings.definition: A microbarometer, an instrument used to measure very small changes in atmospheric pressure.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a microbar to track the subtle shifts in air pressure.
meanings.sent2: The microbar helped predict the upcoming storm by detecting slight pressure changes.
meanings.sent3: The microbar looked like a tiny telescope, but it measured air pressure instead of stars.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was like a microbar, sensing the smallest changes in the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The microbar hummed softly as it recorded the minuscule variations in pressure.
